interview.q: For session creation enforcement, which approach should we take?
interview.a: Remove persist_session flag entirely - Every /api/complete call creates a session. No opt-out. Guarantees 100% tracking.

interview.q: For project_id enforcement, how should we handle calls that don't specify a project?
interview.a: Require project_id - reject calls without it. Return 400 if project_id missing. Forces all callers to identify themselves. Clean attribution.

interview.q: Should we migrate projects to use MCP protocol instead of direct HTTP?
interview.a: Remove MCP entirely to reduce codebase/DB complexity. Can add back later if needed. Standardize all projects for optimal internal communication. COMPLETELY remove MCP code/db - nothing left behind. Follow no tech debt mandate. Make sure it doesn't break anything.

interview.q: For SummitFlow's Gemini image generation that bypasses Agent-Hub, what should we do?
interview.a: Route through Agent-Hub. Add image generation endpoint to Agent-Hub. SummitFlow calls Agent-Hub instead of direct Gemini SDK. Full tracking.

interview.q: For the Sessions View in Agent-Hub frontend, what filtering/display capabilities do you need?
interview.a: Filter by project + status + date range. Also clean up/format expanded messages (prettier/syntax highlighting) so they're easy to read and understand.

interview.q: For Live View and session rows design?
interview.a: No separate live view page. Add auto-refresh dropdown (Manual, 5s, 15s, 30s, 60s) to sessions page. Session rows should show pertinent info collapsed, expanded shows additional detail while keeping header visible.
